name: Lying Dumbbell Row Superset with Seated Shrug
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on a flat surface with your knees bent and feet planted firmly on the ground.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, with your arms extended above you and your palms facing towards your body.

3. Engage your core muscles by drawing your belly button towards your spine, ensuring that your hips remain stable throughout the movement.

4. Bend your elbows to lift the dumbbells up and over your chest, keeping your shoulders down and away from your ears.
5. As you raise the dumbbells, squeeze your shoulder blades together and push your chest outwards.
6. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to their starting position.

7. Immediately transition into a seated shrug:
    Sit on the edge of a flat surface with your legs straight out in front of you.
    Hold a dumbbell in each hand, resting them on your thighs.
    Shrug both shoulders up towards your ears, keeping your elbows slightly bent.

8. Return to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Lying dumbbell rows work the muscles in your back, while seated shrugs target your upper back and shoulder areas.
alternative_names: Standing to Lying Dumbbell Row with Seated Shrug
Lying Row to Overhead Shoulder Press Superset
